answers.answer: Dizziness after eating is, most of the times, a symptom of some kind of disorder occurring in the digestive or nervous system/s. This too can happen with diabetics when they consume sugary or high carbohydrated foods. However, I ruled out diabetes when you stated "I ate about 4 nuts and instantly got this dizzy sensation."It's good to see that you have an appointment with a doctor for a complete physical exam. If your PCP cannot get to the bottom of your dizziness ask for a referral to a Gastroenterologist and a Neurologist. Good luck.
